root: ^Peer pressure can be tough, especially around here. How do you handle it?

s: ^I try to stay away from people who bring me down.
^I don’t always handle it well, but I’m trying.
^Sometimes, I just give in. It’s easier than resisting.

Stay_Away: ^Teacher: That’s a good strategy. Surrounding yourself with positive influences can make all the difference.
Trying_To_Handle: ^Teacher: That’s all anyone can ask of you. Just keep trying and don’t be afraid to seek support when you need it.
Give_In: ^Teacher: I understand, but giving in won’t get you where you want to go. You have to learn to stand up for yourself, even when it’s hard.

s: ^You’re right, I need to work on that.

Too_Difficult: ^Teacher: I know it’s tough. But remember, you’re stronger than you think. You don’t have to face this alone—there are people who want to help.
Work_On_That: ^Teacher: That’s the attitude. It takes time, but every little bit of resistance helps you grow stronger.
